extendedIngredients.name: pinto beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Can, drained Pinto Beans (or black beans)

extendedIngredients.name: colby jack cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2½ Cups Colby Jack Cheese, grated (more if you like it extra cheesy.)
metaInformation: (more if you like it extra cheesy.)

extendedIngredients.name: cooked polenta
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Box of Uncooked Polenta or 2 boxes of pre cooked Polenta

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 14 ounce can of fire roasted tomatoes, drained

extendedIngredients.name: roasted garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Old El Paso Roasted Garlic Sauce Packet

recipes.title: Polenta Enchilada Vegetarian Lasagna

winePairing.pairingText: Lasagne works really well with Montepulciano, Sangiovese, and Chianti. Lasagna pairs well with medium-bodied red wine with higher acidity. Sangiovese, Montepulciano, and Chianti all fit the bill. The Valle Reale Vigneto di Popoli Montepulciano d'Abruzzo with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Valle Reale Vigneto di Popoli Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
productMatches.description: At 1,000 feet above sea level, Valle Reale's vineyards are nestled into one of Italy's most beautifulnational parks. This rich 100% Montepulciano d'Abruzzo is made from the oldest estate vineyards,planted back in 1975 on soils rich in chalk, clay and pebbles. Harvested by hand in the second partof October, the grapes are gently pressed and macerated with the skins for 1012days to ensureideal color concentration and structure. After full malolactic fermentation in barrels, the wine ismatured for one more year in the same French barriques and then refined in bottle for another eightmonths.Valle Reale introduces the wine lover to a new breed of Montepulciano. Surprisingly concentrated,with silky tannins and layers of dark berry fruit and spices, this is a rich and aromatic Montepulcianod'Abruzzo. Fullbodiedand firm, yet supple, it is ready to be enjoyed with hearty pasta dishes,roasted poultry or lamb, and ribs.

recipes.instructions: Prepare the polenta, pour into a greased 8x9" casserole dish and chill for 1 hour or up to 1 day. Turn the polenta out onto a cutting board and slice into  to " slices.Heat a grill pan over medium high head and drizzle with a little olive oil. Grill the polenta for 2-3 minutes on each side or until grill marks appear. Set aside.In a small dish, whisk together the enchilada sauce and sour cream.Heat the oven to 375 degrees.Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add a little drizzle of oilive oil. Add the onions, peppers and zucchini. stirring occasionally as it browns. Add in the corn, pinto beans and tomatoes and stir in the sauce.Add 2 spoonfuls of just the sauce to the casserole dish and then layer the polenta side by side. Top with veggies and sauce, a little cheese and then top with more polenta. Repeat layers until you get to the top and end with extra cheese.Bake for 20 minutes then allow to rest for 5 minutes and serve.

steps.step: Prepare the polenta, pour into a greased 8x9" casserole dish and chill for 1 hour or up to 1 day. Turn the polenta out onto a cutting board and slice into  to " slices.

Heat a grill pan over medium high head and drizzle with a little olive oil. Grill the polenta for 2-3 minutes on each side or until grill marks appear. Set aside.In a small dish, whisk together the enchilada sauce and sour cream.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add a little drizzle of oilive oil.
Add the onions, peppers and zucchini. stirring occasionally as it browns.
Add in the corn, pinto beans and tomatoes and stir in the sauce.

Add 2 spoonfuls of just the sauce to the casserole dish and then layer the polenta side by side. Top with veggies and sauce, a little cheese and then top with more polenta. Repeat layers until you get to the top and end with extra cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes then allow to rest for 5 minutes and serve.
